intro: Bursaria procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are woody, three-lobed capsules that split open to release seeds. Bursaria procumbens is often found in coastal and sandy soils, adapting well to arid and saline environments.
